p: Climate change significantly alters the phenology and distribution of the world’s fauna and flora ( Parmesan, 2006). Species with spatially limited distributions suffer particularly from climate-related change in their habitats, which can drive range shifts (e.g., Sekercioglu et al., 2008; Grémillet & Boulinier, 2009), range restrictions ( Sexton et al., 2009) or, in the worst case, extinction ( Thomas et al., 2004). Current climate predictions suggest that the pressure on ecosystems will continue to increase ( IPCC, 2013), especially affecting species that occupy fragmented habitats. The spatial segregation of suitable habitat might preclude range shift adjustments and increase the risk of local extinctions ( Opdam & Wascher, 2004).
